features.name: Fast Movement
features.desc: A barbarian's land {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is faster than the norm for her {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g} by +10 feet. This benefit applies only when she is wearing no armor, light armor, or medium armor, and not carrying a heavy load. Apply this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} before modifying the barbarian's speed because of any load carried or armor worn. This bonus stacks with any other bonuses to the barbarian's land speed.

features.name: Rage
features.desc:
A barbarian can call upon inner reserves of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}strength{/g} and ferocity, granting her additional combat prowess. At 1st level, a barbarian can rage for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. For each level after 1st she possesses, the barbarian can rage for 2 additional rounds per day. Temporary increases to Constitution, such as that gained from bear's endurance, do not increase the total number of rounds that a barbarian can rage per day. A barbarian can enter a rage as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. The total number of rounds of rage per day is renewed after resting for 8 hours, although these hours need not be consecutive.
While in a rage, a barbarian gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. In addition, she takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. She also gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}. These temporary hit points are lost first when a character takes damage, disappear when the rage ends, and are not replenished if the barbarian enters a rage again within 1 minute of her previous rage. While in a rage, a barbarian cannot cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
A barbarian can end her rage as a free {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, and is fatigued for 1 minute after a rage ends. A barbarian can't enter a new rage while fatigued or exhausted, but can otherwise enter a rage multiple times per day. If a barbarian falls {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, her rage immediately ends.

features.name: Barbarian Proficiencies
features.desc: A barbarian is proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).

features.name: Rage Power
features.desc: As a barbarian gains levels, she learns to use her rage in new ways. Starting at 2nd level, a barbarian gains a rage power. She gains another rage power for every two levels of barbarian attained after 2nd level. A barbarian gains the benefits of rage powers only while raging, and some of these powers require the barbarian to take an {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} first. Unless otherwise noted, a barbarian cannot select an individual power more than once.

features.name: Uncanny Dodge
features.desc:
The character can react to danger before her senses would normally allow her to do so. She cannot be caught {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}, nor does she lose her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} if the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacker{/g} is invisible. She still loses her Dexterity bonus to AC if immobilized. A character with this ability can still lose her Dexterity bonus to AC if an opponent successfully uses the feint {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} against her.
If a character already has uncanny dodge from a different class, she automatically gains improved uncanny dodge instead.

features.name: Danger Sense
features.desc: At 3rd level, a barbarian gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} to avoid traps and a +1 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} by traps. These bonuses increase by 1 every 3 levels thereafter (to a maximum of +6 at 18th level).

features.name: Improved Uncanny Dodge
features.desc:
The character can no longer be {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanked{/g}.
This defense denies another rogue the ability to sneak {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} the character by flanking her, unless the attacker has at least four more rogue levels than the target does.

features.name: Damage Reduction
features.desc: At 7th level, a barbarian gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Subtract 1 from the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} the barbarian takes each time she is dealt damage from a weapon or a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g}. At 10th level, and every three barbarian levels thereafter (13th, 16th, and 19th level), this damage reduction rises by 1 point. Damage reduction can reduce damage to 0 but not below 0.

features.name: Greater Rage
features.desc: At 11th level, a barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} while raging increases to +3. In addition, the amount of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} gained when entering a rage increases to 3 per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.

features.name: Indomitable Will
features.desc: While in rage, a barbarian of 14th level or higher gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resist Enchantment spells{/g}. This bonus stacks with all other modifiers, including the morale bonus on Will saves she also receives during her rage.

features.name: Tireless Rage
features.desc: Starting at 17th level, a barbarian no longer becomes fatigued at the end of her rage.

features.name: Mighty Rage
features.desc: At 20th level, a barbarian's {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} while raging increases to +4. In addition, the amount of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} gained when entering a rage increases to 4 per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
